results.title: Dust dance
results.creator_credit: Judy Griffiths, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2000. Judy Griffiths took over her family farm. Having studied agriculture science, Griffiths was able to apply what she learnt to help her care for the land through some of the toughest times her farm has ever seen.

results.title: The Germination and growth of plants
results.creator_credit: Peter Boulton, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Boulton-Hawker Films
results.brief_description: Explains the origins of fruits, the general structure of seeds and through simple classroom experiments, the conditions necessary for germination. Examines hypogeal and epigeal germination and presents the early development of seedlings using time lapse techniques following root system development and shoot growth. Accompanied by an 8p. Study Guide.

results.title: The General [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton, Clyde Bruckman, Joseph Schenck, United Artists Corporation and Buster Keaton Productions
results.brief_description: Keaton’s best, and arguably the greatest screen comedy ever made. Against a meticulously evoked Civil War background, Buster risks life, limb and love as he pursues his beloved railway engine, hijacked by Northern spies up to no good for the Southern cause. The result is everything one could wish for; witty, dramatic, visually stunning, full of subtle, delightful human insights, and constantly hilarious. Cast includes Buster Keaton and Marion Mack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Buster Keaton, Clyde Bruckman, Joseph Schenck, United Artists Corporation and Buster Keaton Productions

results.title: The Gentle art of film projection
results.creator_credit: Donald Peters, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Some pointers on the art of film projection, told through the humorous story of a poor showman who lost his film audience because he didn’t know how to operate a 16mm projector. The moment that George Beesley appears on the scene we know something ridiculous is bound to happen—and it does! This sad sack merrily muddles through the film showing and annoys his audience so thoroughly that they walk out in disgust. An interested spectator then patiently explains the principles of efficient projection, while animated sequences demonstrate the construction of a projector, the preparation in advance of the room to be used for the showing, and the correct placement of screen and loudspeaker. Procedures for preventing damage to film and equipment are outlined. Animation by Wolf Koenig.

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 5.
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: In a ‘Tale of two cities’, Conrad works out that Bruce and Baz are genies and tries to learn more about their secret powers. In ‘School daze’ Penelope wishes herself back in England to avoid having to go to school in Australia and finds that she has to sit a “catch up” exam at her school when she returns.

results.title: Under the veneer
results.brief_description: An ACMI digital storytelling project funded by Barwon Health that celebrates and values the unique experiences of people living in Norlane, Corio and Whittington.

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 4.
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Brendan Maher, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Another two exciting episodes in this excellent series for children. In ‘Nobody’s perfect’, in an effort to stop Bruce from misinterpreting her wishes, Penelope writes down her perfect wish. In ‘Triple agent’, Conrad is convinced that Bruce may be a vampire or cyborg and tries to catch him out.

results.title: The Geisha boy
results.creator_credit: Frank Tashlin, Jerry Lewis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Gilbert Woolley (Jerry Lewis) is a third rate magician who has difficulty securing regular work in America when he is sent on a tour of Japan to entertain the troops. With his hapless and accident-prone ways Gilbert offends precious starlet Lois Livingston who is also on the bill, and raises the ire of the military with a series of embarrassing incidents. An aristocratic Japanese patron, who is impressed by Gilbert’s ability to amuse her depressed and reclusive young nephew Robert, saves Gilbert’s career from obscurity. Smitten with Gilbert, Robert causes an international diplomatic incident by following him back to the US. Even though it occasionally lapses into sentimental mawkishness, this film features much physical comedy as well as the usual mugging typical of Lewis’ schtick. “The Geisha boy” is one of director Tashlin’s eight collaborations with comedian Jerry Lewis (others include The Disorderly, Hollywood or bust, Who’s minding the store?).

results.title: A Trip to Wanderer's Paradise
results.brief_description: Laura reminisces about a very special holiday that happened at a time when she badly needed a break - an unexpected holiday that was like an answer to her prayers.

results.title: The Genie from down under: wishing and hoping
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When upper class English girl Penelope Townes finds a magic opal which contains two Australian genies, Bruce and his son Baz, she thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have anything she wants. Bruce, however, has other ideas.
